weather_report:
As the sun sets over Evanston, a crisp chill fills the air with temperatures lingering in the low teens and wind gusts stirring the atmosphere from the northwest. Currently, it feels colder with a wind chill dipping down to the single digits, giving a stark reminder of the winter heft. The beach presents a tranquil yet stark beauty, with the gentle wave action on Lake Michigan reflecting glimmers of light, though the overall visibility is shadowy as night approaches.

Tonight, conditions will remain partly cloudy, with temperatures expected to plummet to around 9 degrees. The winds will soften to a gentle breeze, providing a slight reprieve from the day's bluster. Tomorrow brings a forecast of partially sunny skies with highs creeping up to the low 30s, yet still, very much a wintry chill remains ever-present. The lake will likely generate some gentle waves, but no significant swells are anticipated. There's no precipitation on the horizon, keeping the air dry, though warmth is an elusive notion this time of year. Dress warmly in layers and don a winter coat, perhaps with a snug hat and gloves to fend off the cold. With such winter conditions, outdoor activities will be limited, but a brisk walk along the beach could invigorate the spirit, allowing a moment of quiet reflection amidst the season's stillness.
